f93e61e1-841f-4425-8a47-e5d8b052b8f0.description: The earner of this badge utilizes emotional intelligence by recognizing, understanding, managing, and reasoning with emotions. They have identified and properly managed virtual relationship, reduce negative morale and behaviors, and improve job performance and satisfaction in any organization. They have enhanced individual and group decisions and outcomes through application of emotional intelligence.
f93e61e1-841f-4425-8a47-e5d8b052b8f0.name: Emotional Intelligence in the Remote Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended the CMU live webinar and learned the emotional quotient model or emotional intelligence in the remote workplace.

7a154e5a-6b41-410c-920c-60ce6b8b9bf9.description: The earner of this badge has learned how to successfully manage projects in the virtual workplace. They understand how to define, communicate, and meet project goals when outside of the work environment. They also understand how to ensure that project goals achieved with people skills in mind.
7a154e5a-6b41-410c-920c-60ce6b8b9bf9.name: Project Management in the Virtual Environment

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has attended a CMU live webinar that discusses how to successfully manage projects in a virtual environment.

97ec6737-d7e8-44db-8365-78301e4b40ec.description: The earner of this badge understands the advantages of meeting the challenge of change in an industry and economic sector. They have completed the webinar session that reviews how leaders can create environments that provide structure, without constraining critical thinking, new ideas, and creative solutions
97ec6737-d7e8-44db-8365-78301e4b40ec.name: Disruptive Change: Corporate and Personal

badge_template_activities.title: This earner has attended the CMU live webinar session discussing the advantage of leveraging valuable knowledge and the advantage of increasing sales that take advantage of economies of sale. They have also discussed how to represent brand recognition, how to gain the ability to exploit the network, and the benefits of switching costs to improve profitability.

420dc097-c6e0-49d9-bdbf-eba6f1ba2be6.description: Becoming an Emotionally Intelligent Teacher professional development webinar from CMU is designed to increase an educator's knowledge, skills, and abilities in Emotional Intelligence practices in the classroom. The badge earner is able to recognize, understand, manage, and reason with emotions. The badge earner participated in strategies to manage school relationships, reduce negative morale/behaviors, and improve job performance/satisfaction.
420dc097-c6e0-49d9-bdbf-eba6f1ba2be6.name: Becoming an Emotionally Intelligent Teacher

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has attended the CMU live webinar and learned the emotional quotient model and applied it to classroom emotional intelligence.

02555661-f7cb-4f11-ae43-6b21d8724130.description: The badge earner has examined the skills needed to successfully administer an environment that facilitates workplace diversity. They have developed an understanding of ethical issues involved in administration.
02555661-f7cb-4f11-ae43-6b21d8724130.name: Career Development in the Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a comprehensive essay the evaluates concept synthesis through pre-designed questions eliciting retention and application of principles to professional settings and situations.
Skills needed to perform advanced IT functions for a large corporation.

Participants must answer the following essay prompts: 1) What is your preferred mode of communication in the workplace? Explain why. 2) Identify two positive and two negative experiences you have had working in groups. 3) Of the 9 power (Influence) tactics that was discussed, which two would you most like to use? Explain why. 4) Describe what you feel are two positive and two negative aspects of organizational politics.
Kouzes, J. M., Posner, B. Z. (2017). The Leadership Challenge. Hoboken, NJ: Wiley

79e66323-2c80-4aea-9dd7-44fa69853097.description: The earner of this badge attended a Central Michigan University (CMU) webinar that provided information about the emotional intelligence (EQ) theory. The badge earner participated in a 40-minute session which introduced EQ concepts to develop and foster strong virtual relationships. Participants were encouraged to develop a continuous improvement plan to increase EQ levels through self-assessment techniques under the four emotional intelligence domains.
79e66323-2c80-4aea-9dd7-44fa69853097.name: Emotional Intelligence for Returning to School: The art of identifying your emotions during challenging times

badge_template_activities.title: Short EI assessment was conducted along with a participation survey.

c5af14df-7f6c-4bbd-93b7-f2c4a17c2261.description: Earners of this badge have examined organizational culture and implications for leadership. They understand diverse organizational settings which require the individual to develop appropriate decision making and planning strategies. They have evaluated and have a knowledge of fundamental concepts, procedures, and practices concerning organizational function.
c5af14df-7f6c-4bbd-93b7-f2c4a17c2261.name: Organizational Culture in the Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a comprehensive essay that requires an evaluation of concept synthesis through pre-designed questions eliciting retention and application of principles to professional settings and situations.
Skills needed to perform advanced IT functions for a large corporation.

Participants must answer essay prompts such as 1) What do you think is the most important aspect of organizational culture? Explain Why. 2) How important is the relationship between personal and corporate values? Explain. 3) Based on the grid personality exercise, what is your greatest strength? Weakness? Explain why. 4) Briefly describe the BCBS culture. Include at least three aspects.
Kouzes, J. M., Posner, B. Z. (2017). The Leadership Challenge. Hoboken, NJ: Wiley

3b9cebef-cb84-432f-baf6-cf27180c7492.description: The earner of this badge has examined the processes and approaches used by administrators to analyze internal and external environments to establish and accomplish long-term strategic organizational goals. They have applied strategies for effective cross-cultural administration while focusing on developing personal cultural intelligence.
3b9cebef-cb84-432f-baf6-cf27180c7492.name: Influence in the Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a comprehensive essay that evaluates concept synthesis through pre-designed questions eliciting retention and application of principles to professional settings and situations.
Skills needed to perform advanced IT functions for a large corporation

Participants must answer the following essay prompts: 1) Under what circumstances would you utilize participative management? When would you not utilize it? 2) Describe your personal leadership style and its major components 3) What two specific things can you do to increase your credibility with your manager. Explain. 4) At this stage of your career, what type of training is most beneficial for you? Explain why.
Kouzes, J. M., Posner, B. Z. (2017). The Leadership Challenge. Hoboken, NJ: Wiley

c37f2632-4d69-48b4-b941-5ddfc4158c58.description: The earner of this badge has the knowledge of how to examine emotional intelligence that integrates leadership as a foundation for managing organizational change. They evaluated and applied fundamental concepts, procedures, and practices concerning organizational function.
c37f2632-4d69-48b4-b941-5ddfc4158c58.name: Yourself, Co-workers, and the Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: Skills needed to perform advanced IT functions for a large corporation.
Completion of a comprehensive essay that evaluates concept synthesis through pre-designed questions eliciting retention and application of principles to professional settings and situations.

Participants must answer the following essay prompts: 1)What was the most significant thought/idea that you took away from reading the first four chapters of the Leadership Challenge? Briefly explain. 2) Can you have EI and still be emotional in the workplace? Briefly explain. 3) What occurs if the verbal cues and nonverbal cues don't match? Why? 4) Outside of money, what is the most significant motivator for you? Briefly explain.
Kouzes, J. M., Posner, B. Z. (2017). The Leadership Challenge. Hoboken, NJ: Wiley

f9c3ffef-dde6-4094-88ba-0a02f78ed682.description: The earner of this badge has met the requirements to register for the CAPM exam. The student demonstrated how to define, communicate, and meet project goals. The student articulated how to ensure that project goals are achieved with people skills in mind. Central Michigan University and the Project Management Institute (PMI) - Great Lakes Chapter offer this professional development course that prepares students for the CAPM certification examination.
f9c3ffef-dde6-4094-88ba-0a02f78ed682.name: Certification Associate in Project Management (CAPM) Prep Course

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has attended and participated in a 36-hour, four-week accelerated course, that discusses how to successfully manage projects, people, inputs, outputs, and other project planning competencies. The course will aid in improving test-taking capabilities by learning how to dissect questions and restate what is being asked in order to work through selecting the best answer for the CAPM examination.

e2c2d06d-329a-41e9-ade8-4e529da01abf.description: The earner of this badge has met the requirements of the school administrator preparation course Module 2 – School and Community Relations. The candidate demonstrated how to effectively engage in school and community relations. Central Michigan University and the Department of Counseling, Educational Leadership & Higher Education offer this professional development course that prepares candidates for the Michigan Elementary and Secondary School Administrator Certification.
e2c2d06d-329a-41e9-ade8-4e529da01abf.name: Community Relations - School Administrator Preparation Series

alignments.name: The National Education Leadership Preparation Standards
alignments.description: The NELPS outline the knowledge and skills that a well-prepared beginning school administrator should have upon successfully completing a preparation program. The NELPS are comprised of eight standards with subsequent components that provide detailed context and clarification for each overarching standard.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has attended and participated in a school administrator preparation module on skills for community outreach and communication. The module discusses how to successfully engage in school PR, community partnerships, and the communication process, including effective stakeholder communication and crisis communication, communicating through online and social media, communicating financial issues, and school marketing.

1f79b5cf-b6ed-47d0-aef4-723fd997a5a7.description: The earner of this badge has met the requirements of the school administrator preparation course Module 1 – School Leadership. The candidate demonstrated how to effectively lead a PK-12 school program. Central Michigan University and the Department of Counseling, Educational Leadership & Higher Education offer this professional development course that prepares candidates for the Michigan Elementary and Secondary School Administrator Certification.
1f79b5cf-b6ed-47d0-aef4-723fd997a5a7.name: School Leadership - School Administrator Preparation Series

alignments.name: The National Education Leadership Preparation Standards
alignments.description: The NELPS outline the knowledge and skills that a well-prepared beginning school administrator should have upon successfully completing a preparation program. The NELPS are comprised of eight standards with subsequent components that provide detailed context and clarification for each overarching standard.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has attended and participated in a school administrator preparation module on skills for effective school leadership. The module discusses how to successfully manage a school program, including aspects of school culture, instructional leadership, school improvement, student services, creating safe schools, human resource management, and public relations for principals.

5c4fbbd8-44df-4b8d-aafe-dfb887431238.description: CLO3D I-The Basics is a professional development online course from Central Michigan University that provides a digital integrated design studio focused on basic pattern development through 3D fit, visualization, and animation. The experience focused on applied design critiques and aesthetic development. The learners used CLO3D software to design garments and develop patterns; apply sewing and arrange on avatar; select fabrics and illustrate colorways; and apply basic presentation techniques.
5c4fbbd8-44df-4b8d-aafe-dfb887431238.name: CLO3D I - The Basics

badge_template_activities.title: Content is delivered asynchronously through recorded lectures and software demonstrations. Personalized virtual office hours with a CMU Fashion Design faculty member provides additional learning support.

b60ff442-a498-46d2-83ff-8ee705df4733.description: This online program, provided by Ed2Go, has taught this badge earner the foundational aspects of HR such as human resource laws, hiring disciplines, and labor relations. They understand practices that align with the Human Resource Certification Institute (HRCI) and the Society for Human Resource Management. The earner has gained the skills necessary to sit for HRCI's Professional in Human Resources (PHR) certification exam.
b60ff442-a498-46d2-83ff-8ee705df4733.name: Human Resources Certification Training

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has successfully completed the Human Resources Professional course. The earner is required to pass and complete the final exam within this course.

Ed2Go offers Advanced Career Training Programs that are designed for students who are looking to start a new career or gain skills to advance in their existing career. Career Training Programs provide the student with a one-on-one experience in which they work closely with an advisor to prepare them for industry certification or to prepare them to start a new career. Upon completion, the student will receive a CMU recognized certificate of completion.

e2be9895-40cd-442a-9335-b73224319e81.description: This online course, offered through Ed2Go, has prepared the earner to sit for the Certified Professional Coder exam. The earner has built a foundation of medical vocabulary. They have also learned current medical coding standards by working with the coding manuals ICD-10-CM, ICD-10-PCS, CPT, and HCPCS Level II. The Certified Professional Coder exam is offered by the American Academy of Professional Coders.
e2be9895-40cd-442a-9335-b73224319e81.name: CPC Medical Billing and Coding Certification Training

badge_template_activities.title: Ed2Go offers Advanced Career Training Programs that are designed for students who are looking to start a new career or gain skills to advance in their existing career. Career Training Programs provide the student with a one-on-one experience in which they work closely with an advisor to prepare them for industry certification or to prepare them to start a new career. Upon completion, the student will receive a CMU recognized certificate of completion.

fad76a6a-196e-4adb-9dd8-be46d6b8cad4.description: The earner of this badge has met the requirements of the school administrator preparation course Module 4 – Public School Law. The candidate demonstrated how to address public school legal and policy issues. Central Michigan University and the Department of Counseling, Educational Leadership & Higher Education offer this professional development course that prepares candidates for the Michigan Elementary and Secondary School Administrator Certification.
fad76a6a-196e-4adb-9dd8-be46d6b8cad4.name: Public School Law - School Administrator Preparation Series

alignments.name: The National Education Leadership Preparation Standards
alignments.description: The NELPS outline the knowledge and skills that a well-prepared beginning school administrator should have upon successfully completing a preparation program. The NELPS are comprised of eight standards with subsequent components that provide detailed context and clarification for each overarching standard.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has attended and participated in a school administrator preparation module on skills for addressing legal and policy matters for school leaders. The module provides an overview of the legal framework for public education, policy governance, ethical considerations for educational leaders, diversity, equity, and inclusion and student discipline, student and teacher rights, responsibilities, and potential liability, as well as students with disabilities and discrimination.

b09a80ff-ad77-482b-8e7c-31f27f1ca27f.description: A study of health education programs and practices for teachers. The live online session identified instructional strategies that support all learners in order to demonstrate positive personal and social behaviors within a productive, supportive learning environment. The participant was exposed to techniques for individual and group problem-solving to develop positive and supportive relationships, teach positive social skills, and promote strategies for conflict resolution.
b09a80ff-ad77-482b-8e7c-31f27f1ca27f.name: Resetting, Reframing, and Recharging During Late Spring Stress

badge_template_activities.title: At the conclusion of the webinar, the participant will have knowledge to implement instructional strategies that support all learners in order to demonstrate positive personal and social behaviors within a productive, supportive learning environment. During the session, the participant will analyze assessment strategies and tools to determine their appropriateness for enhancing student learning. Lastly, the participant will reinforce positive mental and emotional health habits.

2f0dfcca-a69c-4ebd-adae-6f904ce37483.description: The earner of this badge has met the requirements of the school administrator preparation course Module 3 – School Business Administration. The candidate demonstrated how to effectively manage school resources. Central Michigan University and the Department of Counseling, Educational Leadership & Higher Education offer this professional development course that prepares candidates for the Michigan Elementary and Secondary School Administrator Certification.
2f0dfcca-a69c-4ebd-adae-6f904ce37483.name: School Business Administration - School Administrator Preparation Series

alignments.name: The National Education Leadership Preparation Standards
alignments.description: The NELPS outline the knowledge and skills that a well-prepared beginning school administrator should have upon successfully completing a preparation program. The NELPS are comprised of eight standards with subsequent components that provide detailed context and clarification for each overarching standard.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has attended and participated in a school administrator preparation module on skills for resource management. The module discusses how to successfully oversee and manage school financial resources, including budgeting and accounting, resource management and allocation, human resource administration, school environment and motivation, employee performance evaluations, and facilities management.

3d930c1b-d42c-4f2b-9ea8-b7d2e4371038.description: The earner of this badge has met the requirements of the school administrator preparation course Module 5 – Leadership of School Curriculum. The candidate demonstrated how to develop and lead the school curriculum. Central Michigan University and the Department of Counseling, Educational Leadership & Higher Education offer this professional development course that prepares candidates for the Michigan Elementary and Secondary School Administrator Certification.
3d930c1b-d42c-4f2b-9ea8-b7d2e4371038.name: School Curriculum - School Administrator Preparation Series

alignments.name: The National Education Leadership Preparation Standards
alignments.description: The NELPS outline the knowledge and skills that a well-prepared beginning school administrator should have upon successfully completing a preparation program. The NELPS are comprised of eight standards with subsequent components that provide detailed context and clarification for each overarching standard.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has attended and participated in a school administrator preparation module on skills for planning, designing, evaluating, and implementing school curricula. The module provides an overview of the nature of curriculum in schools, the foundations of curriculum, the curricular process, including alignment, management, differentiation, and technology integration, as well as current trends in school curriculum.

bc3765e5-33ca-4b4a-8955-40e22a7046f8.description: The earner of this badge has met the requirements of the school administrator preparation course Module 6 – Leading School Improvement. The candidate demonstrated how to effectively implement the school improvement process. Central Michigan University and the Department of Counseling, Educational Leadership & Higher Education offer this professional development course that prepares candidates for the Michigan Elementary and Secondary School Administrator Certification.
bc3765e5-33ca-4b4a-8955-40e22a7046f8.name: School Improvement - School Administrator Preparation Series

alignments.name: The National Education Leadership Preparation Standards
alignments.description: The NELPS outline the knowledge and skills that a well-prepared beginning school administrator should have upon successfully completing a preparation program. The NELPS are comprised of eight standards with subsequent components that provide detailed context and clarification for each overarching standard.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has attended and participated in a school administrator preparation module on skills for leading school improvement. The module provides an overview of the school improvement process, data-informed decision-making, research on school improvement, needs assessment and root-cause identification, solution identification, action planning, implementation, and evaluation, as well as stakeholder engagement in the planning process.
